title: Dennis Scholes
text:
Dennis Scholes (August 1928 – January 2016) was a professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1940s, 1950s and 1960s. He played at club level for <a href="Maybury%20Youth%20Club%20A.R.L.F.C.">Maybury Youth Club</a> <a href="Maybury%20Youth%20Club%20ARLFC">ARLFC</a> (in <a href="Kingston%20upon%20Hull">Kingston upon Hull</a>), <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull Kingston Rovers</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers%20players">Heritage №</a>) (two spells), <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Leeds%20Rhinos%20players">Heritage №</a>), <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone Rovers</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Featherstone%20Rovers%20players">Heritage № 374</a>), <a href="Doncaster%20R.L.F.C.">Doncaster</a> (Heritage No. 129), as a or <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Utility">utility</a>, i.e. number 1, or, 11 or 12, during the era of contested <a href="Scrum%20%28rugby%29%23Rugby%20league">scrum</a>s.
Playing career.
Dennis Scholes was signed by <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull Kingston Rovers</a> during 1946, he made his début for <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull Kingston Rovers</a> against <a href="Liverpool%20Stanley">Liverpool Stanley</a> at <a href="Old%20Craven%20Park">Old Craven Park</a>, <a href="Kingston%20upon%20Hull">Kingston upon Hull</a> during December 1947, he was transferred from Hull Kingston Rovers to <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a> (having scored a <a href="hat-trick%23Rugby%20football">hat-trick</a> of <a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">tries</a> against Leeds two-weeks earlier) during November 1951 for a <a href="transfer%20fee">transfer fee</a> of £4,000 (based on increases in average earnings, this would be approximately £305,100 in 2017). he was transferred from Leeds to <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone Rovers</a>, he made his début for <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone Rovers</a> on Saturday 15 September 1956, and he played his last match for Featherstone Rovers during the <a href="1957%E2%80%9358%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1957–58 season</a>, he was transferred from Featherstone Rovers to <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull Kingston Rovers</a>, he was one of new <a href="coach%20%28sport%29">coach</a>; <a href="Colin%20Hutton">Colin Hutton</a>'s first signings, he played his last match for Hull Kingston Rovers against <a href="York%20Wasps">York</a> at <a href="Old%20Craven%20Park">Old Craven Park</a>, <a href="Kingston%20upon%20Hull">Kingston upon Hull</a> on Friday 26 December 1958, and he was transferred from Hull Kingston Rovers to <a href="Doncaster%20R.L.F.C.">Doncaster</a>, he appears to have scored no drop-goals (or field-goals as they are currently known in Australasia), but prior to the <a href="1974%E2%80%9375%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1974–75 season</a> all goals, whether; <a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">conversion</a>s, <a href="Penalty%20%28rugby%29%23Penalties%20in%20rugby%20league">penalties</a>, or <a href="Drop%20goal%23Rugby%20league">drop-goal</a>s, scored 2-points, consequently prior to this date drop-goals were often not explicitly documented, therefore '0' drop-goals may indicate drop-goals not recorded, rather than no drop-goals scored.
County League appearances.
Dennis Scholes played in <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a>' victory in the <a href="RFL%20Yorkshire%20League">Yorkshire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20leagues">County League</a> during the <a href="1954%E2%80%9355%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1954–55 season</a>.
Genealogical information.
Dennis Scholes' marriage to Sylvia (<a href="Given%20name%23Name%20at%20birth">née</a> Clayton) was registered during third ¼ 1952 in <a href="Kingston%20upon%20Hull">Hull</a> district. They had children; Gillian Scholes birth registered during second ¼ in <a href="Holderness">Holderness</a> district), and Wendy Scholes birth registered during first ¼ in <a href="Kingston%20upon%20Hull">Hull</a> district).
